meanings.definition: A songbird of the thrush family, Turdidae, typically having a brownish plumage and a melodious song.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful mavises sang sweetly in the forest.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the cheerful chirping of the mavises outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The mavises decided to have a singing competition in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like that of a mavises, pure and enchanting.
meanings.sent5: The mavises' melody echoed through the trees, filling the air with joy.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the name 'Mavis'.
meanings.sent1: At the party, there were three mavises chatting by the punch bowl.
meanings.sent2: The mavises were excited to meet their long-lost cousin.
meanings.sent3: The mavises all wore matching hats to the family reunion.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the mavises were known for their kindness and wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The group of mavises stood out in the crowd with their vibrant personalities.
